verses.verse: I said <S%H559><s%>, I will take care <S%H8104><s%> to my ways <S%H1870><s%>, that I sin <S%H2398><s%> not with my tongue <S%H3956><s%>: I will keep <S%H8104><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%> with a bridle <S%H4269><s%>, while the wicked is before me <S%H7563><s%>.
I was mute <S%H481><s%> with silence <S%H1747><s%>, I held my peace <S%H2814><s%>, even from good <S%H2896><s%>; and my sorrow <S%H3511><s%> was stirred <S%H5916><s%>.

My heart <S%H3820><s%> was hot <S%H2552><s%> inside <S%H7130><s%> me <S%H1901><s%>, while I was musing the fire <S%H784><s%> burned <S%H1197><s%>: then <S%H227><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> I with my tongue <S%H3956><s%>,
Lord <S%H3068><s%>, make me to know <S%H3045><s%> my end <S%H7093><s%>, and the measure <S%H4060><s%> of my days <S%H3117><s%>, what it is <S%H3045><s%>; that I may know how frail I am <S%H2310><s%>.

Behold <S%H5414><s%>, you have made my days <S%H3117><s%> as a handbreadth <S%H2947><s%>; and my age <S%H2465><s%> is as nothing before you <S%H3605><s%>: truly every man <S%H120><s%> at his best state <S%H5324><s%> is altogether <S%H3605><s%> vanity <S%H1892><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.

Surely every man <S%H376><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> in a vain show <S%H6754><s%>: surely they are disquieted <S%H1993><s%> in vain <S%H1892><s%>: he heaps up <S%H6651><s%> riches <S%H3045><s%>, and knows not who shall gather them <S%H622><s%>.
And now <S%H136><s%>, Lord, what wait <S%H6960><s%> I for <S%H8431><s%>? my hope is in you.
Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from all my transgressions <S%H6588><s%>: make <S%H7760><s%> me not the reproach <S%H2781><s%> of the foolish <S%H5036><s%>.
I was mute <S%H481><s%>, I opened <S%H6605><s%> not my mouth <S%H6310><s%>; because you did it <S%H6213><s%>.
Remove <S%H5493><s%> your stroke <S%H5061><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> from me <S%H3615><s%>: I am consumed by the blow <S%H8409><s%> of your hand <S%H3027><s%>.

When you with rebukes <S%H8433><s%> do correct <S%H3256><s%> man <S%H376><s%> for iniquity <S%H5771><s%>, you make his beauty <S%H2530><s%> to consume away <S%H4529><s%> like a moth <S%H6211><s%>: surely every man <S%H120><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.

Hear <S%H8085><s%> my prayer <S%H8605><s%>, O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and give ear <S%H238><s%> unto my cry <S%H7775><s%>; hold not your peace <S%H2790><s%> at my tears <S%H1832><s%>: for I am a stranger <S%H1616><s%> with you <S%H8453><s%>, and a foreigner, as all my fathers were <S%H1><s%>.
O spare <S%H8159><s%> me <S%H1082><s%>, that I may recover strength, before I go here <S%H3212><s%>, and be no more.
